That's a great approach! Asking your mom about her childhood and her experiences growing up in South Korea can be a wonderful way to learn more about your heritage and cultural roots. And by showing genuine interest and respect, you can create a safe and open space for her to share her stories with you.

Remember to be patient, attentive, and non-judgmental as you listen to her experiences. It's essential to create a comfortable and respectful atmosphere, where your mom feels heard and understood.

As you have this conversation, keep in mind that your mom's experiences may be deeply personal and emotional. Be prepared to listen actively and empathetically, and avoid interrupting or offering unsolicited advice. Instead, focus on understanding her perspective and validating her feelings.

By doing so, you'll not only learn more about your mom's experiences but also deepen your bond with her. This conversation can be a powerful way to connect with your heritage and cultural roots, and to gain a deeper understanding of your mom's journey.

As you embark on this conversation, I wish you both a wonderful and enriching experience. May you learn, grow, and connect with each other in meaningful ways!

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. I'm always here to help.
